title: Post to Building
description: An application can create new building record or update existing records. If the Datatel code does not exist in the database, the rest of the data sent in the POST request will be treated as a new entry. If the Datatel code does exist in the database, the data sent in the POST request will replace the data in that record.

Success 200.description: Tells the application if the request was successful.
The action that was performed. This may be update or create.

examples.title: Ruby
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/ruby
response = Unirest.get "https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building",
headers:{ "X-Authorization" => "<Your-API-Key>", "Accept" => "application/json" },
parameters:{ :name => "Ackerman", :code => "ACK"}.to_json

examples.title: PHP
PowerShell
examples.content:
# PowerShell v3 and above
$headers = New-Object "System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary[[String],[String]]"
$headers.Add("X-Authorization", '<Your-API-Key>')
$uri = https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building
$body = @{ name = "Ackerman", code = "ACK" }
$result = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $uri -Headers $headers -Method Post -Body $body

examples.title: Java
examples.content:
# This code snippet uses an open-source library. http://unirest.io/java
HttpResponse <String> response = Unirest.get("https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building")
.header("X-Authorization", "<Your-API-Key>")
.header("Accept", "application/json")
.body("{\"name\":\"Ackerman\", \"code\":\"ACK\"}")
.asString();

examples.title: Python
.NET
examples.content:
// This code snippet uses an open-source library http://unirest.io/net
 Task<HttpResponse<MyClass>> response = Unirest.post("https://databridge.sage.edu/v1/building")
 .header("X-Authorization", "<Your-API-Key>")
 .header("Accept", "application/json")
 .field("name", "Ackerman")
 .field("code", "ACK")
 .asString();

Error 4xx.description: Tells the application if the request was successful.
The application does not access to perform that action.
The application does have access, but the commit failed. This is due to an error on the server.
